intro: Cistanthe anceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Cistanthe anceps is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in regions like Namibia and South Africa.
